intro: Coccoloba baracoensis, commonly known as the Bahamian beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Bahamas and parts of the Greater Antilles. The plant is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and saline environments. Its leaves are usually lobed and have a distinctive, waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
